resources.string: Select A Link To Begin Learning Android:
The terminology button provides android terms. When an individual term is pressed, the corresponding definition is displayed
The website button provides 12 links to begin learning android development.

string-array.name: definitions
string-array.item: Android Developer Bridge allows access to the virtual device
Takes a screenshot of the virtual device
Contains an application\'s release/debug packages as well as lint files
Contains XML files that determine how an application will be displayed
Contains XML files that contain resource values
Different applications are organized into Android Studio projects
Used to separate different windows in Android Studio
Contains tools that can be used to access Android Studio features
Shows the results of build processes
Allows you to see how your applications would be displayed on your AVD
Allows you to interact with the virtual device(e.g. take a screenshot)
Shows all files relevant to the current project
Shows text-based errors that would result in a bad build
A small component of an application. Used in tandem with other modules
Allows you to view an applications interface without the need to run it
Creates a new empty repository or overwrites an existing repository
Allows for changes to a repository
Allows project references to be updated
Upload specified files to git repository
Update the project by using external files other repositories or branches
Shows all available, while also allowing for creation and deletion of others
Copies existing repository into a new directory
